name: Analyzer
description: The Analyzer class identifies the analyzer from which the Alert or Heartbeat message originates.  Only one analyzer may be encoded for each alert or heartbeat, and that MUST be the analyzer at which the alert or heartbeat originated.  Although the IDMEF data model does not prevent the use of hierarchical intrusion detection systems (where alerts get relayed up the tree), it does not provide any way to record the identity of the "relay" analyzers along the path from the originating analyzer to the manager that ultimately receives the alert.

Node.name: Node
Node.description: Information about the host or device on which the analyzer resides (network address, network name, etc.).

Process.name: Process
Process.description: Information about the process in which the analyzer is executing.

analyzerid.name: analyzerid
analyzerid.description: (but see below).  A unique identifier for the analyzer; see Section 3.2.9.

name.name: name
name.description: An explicit name for the analyzer that may be easier to understand than the analyzerid.

manufacturer.name: manufacturer
manufacturer.description: The manufacturer of the analyzer software and/or hardware.

model.name: model
model.description: The model name/number of the analyzer software and/or hardware.

version.name: version
version.description: The version number of the analyzer software and/or hardware.

class.name: class
class.description: The class of analyzer software and/or hardware.

ostype.name: ostype
ostype.description: Operating system name.  On POSIX 1003.1 compliant systems, this is the value returned in utsname.sysname by the uname() system call, or the output of the "uname -s" command.

osversion.name: osversion
osversion.description: Operating system version.  On POSIX 1003.1 compliant systems, this is the value returned in utsname.release by the uname() system call, or the output of the "uname -r" command.
